results.title: Nickelodeon
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Irwin Winkler, Robert Chartoff and Peter Bogdanovich
results.brief_description: Heartfelt valentine to early days of moviemaking, with O’Neal literally stumbling into his job as director, and Reynolds as an overnight screen hero. Before making this tribute to the brilliant, haphazard early days of Hollywood filmmaking, director/screenwriter Peter Bogdanovich interviewed several veteran filmmakers including John Ford, Raoul Walsh, Allan Dwan and Howard Hawks.

results.title: Nicholas and Alexandra
results.creator_credit: Granite Film, Granada International Productions, Armorer Wason and Michael Beckham
results.brief_description: For over 70 years the story of Russia’s last Tsar, Nicholas II and his Empress, Alexandra has exercised a poignant magic. Presented by His Royal Highness Prince Michael of Kent, this documentary delves into the imperial archives held in Moscow and St Petersberg, once sealed by the Secret Police and forbidden to all but a handful of curators. The archives reveal intimate diaries and letters of the Romanovs, their photograph albums, records of state visits and political intrigue.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Granite Film, Granada International Productions, Armorer Wason and Michael Beckham

results.title: Nicholas and Alexandra
results.creator_credit: Columbia, Horizon (US), Horizon (GB), Sam Spiegel and Franklin J. Schaffner
results.brief_description: A dazzling cast, with Michael Jayston and Janet Suzman playing the lead roles of the ill-fated Czar Nicholas II, and the Czarina Alexandra. Born to be one of the world’s most powerful men, Nicholas ruled millions of people with an empire stretching over one-sixth of the globe. His belief in the Divine Right to rule, made him oblivious to the hardships endured by many of his subjects who were ready to embrace the powerful ideals proposed by Lenin and his followers. The Czarina, in a desperate bid to find a cure for their haemophiliac son, relies heavily on the seductive and mysterious “Mad Monk” Rasputin. Once Lenin and his Bolsheviks gain power, the Royal Family is doomed. “Nicholas and Alexandra” is filled with the pomp and pageantry of history’s great events.

results.creator_credit: BFI, Claude Goretta and Alain Tanner
results.brief_description: A notable experimental documentary featuring the sights and sounds of Piccadilly Circus on a Saturday night. Music by Chas McDevitt Skiffle Group. Cinematography and sound by John Fletcher.

results.title: Nice coloured girls [DVD] (A)
results.brief_description: Nice Coloured Girls uses experimental film techniques in an examination of the new urban ritual of taking white men for a ride. No longer the victims of these men, the women are still trapped by economic necessity. “Nice Coloured Girls” uses a clever juxtaposition of images and voice over of extracts from early journals of white settlers to compare aspects of the relationship between Aboriginal women and white men in the past and in the 1980s. Cast includes Gayle Mabo, Cheryl Pit, Janelle Court, Fiona George and Lindsay McCorrmack. (Awards: London, Berlin, Toronto)

results.title: Nice coloured girls
results.brief_description: Nice Coloured Girls contrasts the relationship between Aboriginal women and white men in the past and the present. The film juxtaposes contemporary images of black women taking advantage of a white man with voice over extracts from early journals of white settlers and sailors, in order to question the validity of conventional white history and to deny the image of Aborigines as passive and powerless.

results.title: Nicaragua no pasaran
results.brief_description: An award-winning documentary that focuses on the guerrilla leader, political fugitive and revolutionary hero, Tomas Borge. Borge, the only surviving member of the original Sandinista movement, is Minister of the Interior in the nine man National Directorate, the collective leadership that governs Nicaragua. He recounts his experiences during his internment under the US-backed Somoza dictatorship. Explains the events which led to the formation of the revolutionary Sandinista movement and its rise to power in 1979. Also explores accusations made by Ronald Reagan that the Sandinista government is involved in activities that threaten to destabilise Central America. Contains b&w sequences. Photography by Geoffrey Simpson.

results.title: Nicaragua 1979: scenes from the revolution
results.brief_description: Documents the Sandinista uprising from the general strike of June 1979 through the first hundred days of reconstruction after the victory. A fast-paced “on the spot” film which eloquently captures the furious demise of the Somoza dynasty in its desperate attempt to turn back the tide of history, and which also paints a powerful portrait of the forces at work within the Nicaraguan revolution.

results.title: Nicaragua
results.creator_credit: Central Independent Television (UK) and Alan Lowery
results.brief_description: John Pilger presents a documentary impression with interviews of Nicaraguan society under the present Sandinista Government; relates a brief history of the events of this century; and returns to protest against American intervention. The film makes no secret of its admiration for Sandinista reforms and its abhorrence of American policy.
